comments:
a.k.a. Choosing columns in the Execution Flow view breaks the view indefinitely

Here's another report I found on the newsgroup. The described symptoms are identical to mine. 
http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.tptp/msg01231.html

STEPS
Prerequisite: you need some profiling data which you can view in the Execution Flow view

1. open the Execution Flow view
2. right-click on the lower half of the view and select Choose Columns...
3. clear the "Start Time" and "Cumulative Time (seconds)" checkboxes
4. press OK
5. close the Execution Flow view
6. open the Execution Flow view as in step 1
Expected: view opens as in step 1
Acutal: exception thrown, view is empty

The view preferences are persisted so the Execution Flow view is unusable hereafter

WORKAROUND
1. exit Eclipse
2. delete the org.eclipse.hyades.trace.views.prefs file from 
workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\ 
3. launch Eclipse

The contents of the eclipse.hyades.trace.views.prefs file: 
#Mon May 08 13:54:10 PDT 2006
eclipse.preferences.version=1
Exec51=thread.name\:0\:7\:left\:200,object.name\:1\:1\:left\:200,method.start.time\:2\:0\:right\:100,method.cumul.time\:3\:0\:right\:100

REGRESSION
Need to test all the columns

Also test that preferences are persisted correctly across launches. I was getting a variety of exceptions depending on the steps I used, though I think the root cause is the same for all. 

ERROR
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.ui.internal.ErrorViewPart

Reason: IWAT0287E Error opening the Execution Flow view.
